events.title: Social Solidarity Program
events.description: Provides assistance to people who can not work.

events.title: Merging of Businesses
events.description: Many small businesses merged to form larger companies to stay competitive.

events.title: Social Economy Projects
events.description: Create jobs, fight poverty and social exclusion.

events.title: Peace of the Braves
events.description: Quebec government allowed to develop hydroelectricity in Cree territory.

events.title: Devitalisation
events.description: Single-industry towns with little economic activity.

events.title: NAFTA
events.description: Eliminated custom duties on most products between North American countries.

events.title: Privatisation
events.description: Certain government services and crown corporations are privatised due to budget cuts.

events.title: CUSFTA
events.description: Eliminated custom duties on most products between Canada and the US.

events.title: Industrial Relocations
events.description: Companies moving away lead to job losses and tax revenue.

events.title: Oil Shock
events.description: Decrease in oil production due to the Iranian Revolution.

events.title: Government Debt
events.description: Quebec and Ottawa had raise tax and go into debt to  maintain services. Some state employees were laid off.

events.title: Unemployment
events.description: Increase in unemployment by 9% (1973-1983).

events.title: OPEC Crises
events.description: Increase in oil price lead to economic recession in Western countries.

events.title: Increased Spending on Healthcare
events.description: Free medicare increased government spending on healthcare.

events.title: Government Pensions
events.description: Insurance and pension plans for workers.

events.title: Crown Corporations
events.description: State-driven economy through state-owned companies.

events.title: Public Investment
events.description: Government investment in infrastructures to modernise the province.

events.title: Widespread Consumer Society
events.description: Increase in wage and more affordable and accessible products.

events.title: Equalisation System
events.description: Federal programs to support poorer provinces.

events.title: Trade with the US
events.description: The US needed raw materials to support their industry in the Cold War.

events.title: Mining Production
events.description: Quebec's mining resources attracted American Businesses.

events.title: Consumer Society
events.description: Increased purchasing power, increased access to credits, mass consumption.

events.title: GATT
events.description: Trade agreement signed with 22 other countries.

events.title: Hydro Quebec
events.description: Nationalisation of electricity.

events.title: Wartime Production
events.description: Produced goods in support of the war effort.

events.title: Government Interventions
events.description: The federal and provincial governments adapted a series of measures to fix the economy.

events.title: Black Thursday
events.description: Wall street stock market crash.

events.title: Roaring 20s
events.description: Economic growth, increased purchasing power.

events.title: Foreign Investment
events.description: The US and the UK invested heavily in Canada.

events.title: Wartime Production
events.description: Canada sold military equipments to the Allies.

events.title: Cooperatives
events.description: Farmers formed cooperatives to get bank loans.

events.title: CHAMP Industries
events.description: New industrial sectors were developed.

events.title: Trade-related Infrastructure
events.description: Infrastructures were constructed to facilitate trade.

events.title: Economic Liberalism
events.description: Limited state intervention in the economy.

events.title: Immigration Policy
events.description: Laurier improved National Policy to attract more immigrants.

events.title: Canals
events.description: Canals were improved to transport goods.

events.title: Mechanisation
events.description: Goods were produced more efficiently.

events.title: Agriculturalism
events.description: New regions were colonised in Quebec.

events.title: Dominion Lands Act
events.description: Free land and passage was given to immigrants.

events.title: Emigration
events.description: French Canadians were leaving Quebec due to overpopulation.

events.title: Rupert's Land Act
events.description: Rupert's land was transferred to Canada.

events.title: Intercolonial Railway
events.description: A rail link between the Maritime and the Province of Canada was constructed.

events.title: End of Reciprocity Treaty
events.description: The Reciprocity Treaty was not renewed.

events.title: Reciprocity Treaty
events.description: Free trade agreement between Canada and the US.

events.title: Abolition of the Seigneurial System
events.description: Yes, it happened, and nobody cares.

events.title: Grand Trunk Railway
events.description: A railway network was constructed to develop trade.

events.title: Abolition of Protectionism
events.description: The UK abolished preferential tariffs and the Corn laws.
